title: It's 2017 - What now?
body: what can this subreddit do besides have a userfriendly side bar i suppose p to improve itself in this new year  thanks so much to everyones support debates and encouragement throughout the year and heres to another year of opposing work and slacking off  nick

title: Would people be more willing to embrace antiwork sentiments if the term "unemployed" was replaced with "early retiree"?
body: would our workobsessed society be more willing and open to embracing the idea of a world off the clock if we reworded the conversation around terms like jobless or unemployed with terms with fewer negative connotations like retired or drudgeryfree
